forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly clear, with a low around 28. West wind around 10 mph, with gusts as high as 26 mph.

forecast.name: Friday
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly sunny, with a high near 38. West wind 9 to 16 mph, with gusts as high as 28 mph.

weather_report:
In the stillness of the early morning, Boston rests beneath a mostly clear canopy, hinting at the briskness of a season that has settled deeply into winter. The chill air, brushing against the skin like a whisper of frost, reaches a low of 28 degrees—the kind of cold that nudges one to burrow deeper into layers of warmth. As the hours unfold, the day promises to greet us with bright, mostly sunny skies above—a brilliant backdrop against which the stark beauty of the cold landscape becomes all the more defined. With a high of near 38 degrees, the warmth of the sun will be fleeting, accentuated by a west wind quietly stirring and nudging the chill into our bones, its gusts reminding us of the season’s capacity for briskness.

As you contemplate your attire for the day, a well-structured coat, perhaps of wool or down, will serve you best, along with a soft scarf to guard against the biting air and gloves to shield those precious fingers. The weather invites a gentle venture outdoors—perhaps a stroll through one of the many serene parks, where the gnarled branches cradle their snow-laden crowns, or along the waterfront, where the mesmerizing dance of the waves echoes the distant heartbeat of the city. It’s a day to appreciate the subtle simplicity of winter’s embrace, to sip a warm beverage filled with the sweetness of the season, and to engage in the quiet, contemplative moments that this time of year so generously offers.
